Welcome to pynomer’s documentation!¶

pynomer API¶

pynomer.pynomer.append(id='', name='', matcher='globi-taxon-cache', p=None, o='tsv')¶

Append term match to row using id and name columns specified in input schema. Multiple matches result in multiple rows.

Parameters

  • id – [string] External id. Default: <empty string>

  • name – [string] Name. Default: <empty string>

  • matcher – [string] Selected matcher. Default: “globi-taxon-cache”

  • p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

  • o – [“tsv”, “json”] Output format. Default: “tsv”

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.append(name="Homo sapiens")
pn.append(id="ITIS:180547", matcher="globi-enrich")
pynomer.pynomer.clean(p=None)¶

Cleans term matcher cache.

Parameters

p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.clean()
pynomer.pynomer.input_schema(p=None)¶

Show input schema in JSON.

Parameters

p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.input_schema()
pynomer.pynomer.matchers(o='tsv', v=False)¶

Lists supported matcher and (optionally) their descriptions.

Parameters

  • o – [“tsv”, “json”] Output format. Default: “tsv”

  • v – [bool] If set, matcher descriptions are included for tsv. Default: False

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.matchers()
pynomer.pynomer.output_schema(p=None)¶

Show output schema.

Parameters

p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.output_schema()
pynomer.pynomer.properties(p=None)¶

Lists configuration properties. Can be used to make a local copy and override default settings.

Parameters

p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.properties()
new_properties = "./path/to/a/property_file"
pn.properties(p=new_properties)
pynomer.pynomer.replace(id='', name='', matcher='globi-taxon-cache', p=None)¶

Replace exact term matches in row. The input schema is used to select the id and/or name to match to. The output schema is used to select the columns to write into.

Parameters

  • id – [string] External id. Default: <empty string>

  • name – [string] Name. Default: <empty string>

  • matcher – [string] Selected matcher. Default: “globi-taxon-cache”

  • p – [string] Path to properties file to override defaults. Default: None

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.replace(name="Homo sapiens")
pn.replace(id="ITIS:180547", matcher="globi-enrich")
pynomer.pynomer.version()¶

Show Version.

Usage:

import pynomer as pn
pn.version()
